tests.title: Test 1 - Basic to Intermediate
tests.cognitiveLevel: Understanding meaning changes and particle placement

transformations.sentence1: The lecturer continued explaining the theory despite numerous interruptions from students.
transformations.sentence2: The lecturer _____ the theory despite numerous interruptions from students.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Must recognize 'continued' = 'went on' + gerund form

transformations.sentence1: My neighbour didn't expect to meet her former teacher whilst shopping in town.
transformations.sentence2: My neighbour unexpectedly _____ her former teacher whilst shopping in town.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Must transform negative expectation to positive surprise, change structure

transformations.sentence1: The government finally abolished the controversial tax after widespread protests.
transformations.sentence2: The government finally _____ the controversial tax after widespread protests.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Formal 'abolished' to phrasal verb, maintain past tense

transformations.sentence1: Students are required to submit their coursework before the deadline expires.
transformations.sentence2: Students must _____ their coursework before the deadline expires.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Change 'are required to' to 'must', recognize submission action

transformations.sentence1: The manager decided not to continue with the risky investment despite earlier enthusiasm.
transformations.sentence2: The manager decided not to _____ the risky investment despite earlier enthusiasm.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Must maintain negative, transform 'continue with' appropriately

transformations.sentence1: The opposition party is conducting a thorough investigation into the minister's financial dealings.
transformations.sentence2: The opposition party is _____ the minister's financial dealings thoroughly.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform noun 'investigation' to verb form, move adverb position

transformations.sentence1: My flatmate always delays doing the washing-up until the sink overflows.
transformations.sentence2: My flatmate always _____ doing the washing-up until the sink overflows.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Recognize 'delays' = 'puts off' + maintain gerund

transformations.sentence1: The department store removed several products from sale following customer complaints.
transformations.sentence2: The department store _____ several products following customer complaints.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Remove 'from sale' clause, maintain meaning with phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Negotiations between the union and management failed after just three hours.
transformations.sentence2: Negotiations between the union and management _____ after just three hours.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'failed' to appropriate phrasal verb, maintain past tense

transformations.sentence1: The research team didn't expect to find groundbreaking evidence whilst analysing old data.
transformations.sentence2: The research team accidentally _____ groundbreaking evidence whilst analysing old data.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform negative expectation to positive surprise with 'accidentally'

tests.title: Test 2 - Intermediate with Structural Changes
tests.cognitiveLevel: Multiple transformations: tense, voice, and structure changes

transformations.sentence1: Despite starting late, the student managed to complete the assignment.
transformations.sentence2: The student managed to _____ the assignment despite starting late.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Reorder sentence, transform 'complete' while maintaining concessive clause

transformations.sentence1: The company rejected the merger proposal unanimously.
transformations.sentence2: The company _____ the merger proposal unanimously.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Formal 'rejected' to informal phrasal verb, maintain past tense

transformations.sentence1: The detective wants to discover the truth about what really happened that night.
transformations.sentence2: The detective is trying to _____ what really happened that night.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Change 'wants to discover' to 'trying to find out', restructure sentence

transformations.sentence1: The shop assistant promised to investigate what happened to the missing parcel.
transformations.sentence2: The shop assistant said she would _____ what happened to the missing parcel.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'promised to investigate' to reported speech with phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: After years of practice, the teenager decided she would no longer continue with her piano lessons.
transformations.sentence2: The teenager decided to _____ her piano lessons after years of practice.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform negative future intention, reorder time clause

transformations.sentence1: Following the scandal, the candidate withdrew his participation from the election race.
transformations.sentence2: The candidate _____ the election race following the scandal.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'withdrew participation from' to simpler phrasal verb + preposition

transformations.sentence1: Because of bad weather, they have postponed the meeting until next month.
transformations.sentence2: The meeting has been _____ until next month due to bad weather.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Active to passive voice, change 'because of' to 'due to', maintain tense

transformations.sentence1: After twenty years of marriage, the couple decided to end their relationship.
transformations.sentence2: The couple _____ after twenty years of marriage.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'decided to end relationship' to simple phrasal verb, reorder

transformations.sentence1: In both appearance and temperament, my sister is remarkably similar to our grandmother.
transformations.sentence2: My sister _____ our grandmother remarkably in both appearance and temperament.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Reorder sentence completely, transform 'is similar to' appropriately

transformations.sentence1: The new software will eliminate the need for manual data entry completely.
transformations.sentence2: The new software will _____ the need for manual data entry.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Remove adverb 'completely', transform 'eliminate' to phrasal verb

tests.title: Test 3 - Advanced with Multiple Changes
tests.cognitiveLevel: Complex: multiple grammatical changes + meaning preservation

transformations.sentence1: As the dissertation deadline approaches rapidly, students are becoming anxious.
transformations.sentence2: The dissertation deadline is _____ and students are becoming anxious.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform time clause to main clause, simplify complex sentence

transformations.sentence1: Before signing retail credit agreements, shoppers should always carefully examine the small print.
transformations.sentence2: Shoppers should always _____ the small print before signing retail credit agreements.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Reorder sentence completely, transform 'carefully examine' with phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Following her recent operation, my grandmother has made a complete recovery.
transformations.sentence2: My grandmother has completely _____ her recent operation.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform noun 'recovery' to verb, change structure completely

transformations.sentence1: During the press conference, the politician refused to make any mention of the allegations.
transformations.sentence2: The politician refused to _____ the allegations during the press conference.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'make any mention of' to simple phrasal verb, reorder time phrase

transformations.sentence1: Next quarter, the company will introduce their new product range to the market.
transformations.sentence2: The company will _____ their new product range next quarter.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'introduce to the market' to phrasal verb, reorder time phrase

transformations.sentence1: While tidying the shelves, the library assistant made an unexpected discovery of several overdue books.
transformations.sentence2: The library assistant _____ several overdue books whilst tidying the shelves.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'made unexpected discovery of' to phrasal verb, simplify structure

transformations.sentence1: To clear excess stock, the clothing retailer is making dramatic reductions in prices.
transformations.sentence2: The clothing retailer is _____ prices dramatically to clear excess stock.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'making reductions in' to phrasal verb, reorder clauses

transformations.sentence1: The leading candidate made a sudden decision to withdraw from the mayoral race.
transformations.sentence2: The leading candidate suddenly _____ the mayoral race.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'made decision to withdraw from' to phrasal verb, change structure

transformations.sentence1: Next week, the architect has scheduled the demolition of the old building.
transformations.sentence2: The architect will _____ the old building next week.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'has scheduled' (present perfect) to future will, simplify structure

transformations.sentence1: Following their disagreement, there was a deterioration in the student's relationship with her supervisor.
transformations.sentence2: The student's relationship with her supervisor _____ following their disagreement.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform noun 'deterioration' to verb, change from 'there was' construction

tests.title: Test 4 - Mixed Challenges with Distractors
tests.cognitiveLevel: Requires rejecting obvious but incorrect options

transformations.sentence1: During the seminar, the leader raised an interesting perspective on contemporary politics.
transformations.sentence2: The seminar leader _____ an interesting perspective on contemporary politics.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'raised' (might suggest 'bring up' OR 'bring out'), choose correctly

transformations.sentence1: My brother has a habit of delaying booking his dental appointments until the pain becomes unbearable.
transformations.sentence2: My brother always _____ booking his dental appointments until the pain becomes unbearable.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'has habit of delaying' to 'always puts off' + maintain gerund

transformations.sentence1: Following safety concerns, the department store withdrew the faulty electrical goods from sale immediately.
transformations.sentence2: The department store _____ the faulty electrical goods immediately.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Remove reason clause, simplify 'withdrew from sale' to phrasal verb
distractors: took out (possible but means 'remove from container')

transformations.sentence1: Whenever students miss lectures, they must create a plausible excuse.
transformations.sentence2: Students must _____ a plausible excuse whenever they miss lectures.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'create' to phrasal verb (not 'come out with'), reorder clauses

transformations.sentence1: Just weeks before the general election, news of the scandal emerged publicly.
transformations.sentence2: Due to severe weather, the airline _____ all flights.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: TRICK QUESTION: sentence1 doesn't match sentence2 - tests if students read carefully!

transformations.sentence1: Finally, my flatmate has stopped his terrible habit of leaving dirty dishes everywhere.
transformations.sentence2: My flatmate finally _____ his terrible habit of leaving dirty dishes everywhere.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'has stopped' (present perfect) to 'gave up' (past simple)

transformations.sentence1: The professor is currently conducting an examination of several theories about medieval literature.
transformations.sentence2: The professor is _____ several theories about medieval literature.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'conducting examination of' to phrasal verb, remove 'currently'

transformations.sentence1: The teenagers made a decision to create their own online business selling vintage clothing.
transformations.sentence2: The teenagers decided to _____ their own online business selling vintage clothing.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'made decision to create' to 'decided to set up'

transformations.sentence1: Every morning, my routine invariably includes the task of checking emails before getting dressed.
transformations.sentence2: My morning routine invariably involves _____ emails before getting dressed.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'includes task of checking' to 'involves going through'

transformations.sentence1: Following irreconcilable policy differences, the coalition government fell apart.
transformations.sentence2: The coalition government _____ following irreconcilable policy differences.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'fell apart' to 'broke up' (not 'broke down' which means 'failed')
distractors: broke down (seems right but means 'fail/stop working')

tests.title: Test 5 - Expert Level Mixed Skills
tests.cognitiveLevel: Maximum complexity: passive voice, reported speech, multiple changes

transformations.sentence1: Whilst researching something entirely different, the student made an accidental discovery of the answer.
transformations.sentence2: The student accidentally _____ the answer whilst researching something entirely different.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'made accidental discovery of' to adverb + phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: Before closing time, the manager needs to distribute the new schedules to everyone.
transformations.sentence2: The manager needs to _____ the new schedules before closing time.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'distribute to everyone' to phrasal verb, remove unnecessary words

transformations.sentence1: In both their looks and personality, the children show remarkable similarity to their father.
transformations.sentence2: The children _____ their father in both looks and personality.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'show remarkable similarity to' to phrasal verb, restructure completely

transformations.sentence1: After days of continuous rain, there was a sudden improvement in the weather.
transformations.sentence2: The weather suddenly _____ after days of continuous rain.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'there was improvement' construction to active voice with phrasal verb

transformations.sentence1: University authorities have begun a thorough investigation into allegations of plagiarism.
transformations.sentence2: University authorities are _____ allegations of plagiarism thoroughly.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Change 'have begun investigation' (present perfect) to present continuous, move adverb

transformations.sentence1: Behind the house, the builder is going to construct a new garage.
transformations.sentence2: The builder will _____ a new garage behind the house.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Change 'going to construct' to 'will put up', reorder location phrase

transformations.sentence1: About the charity event, the volunteers are planning to distribute leaflets.
transformations.sentence2: The volunteers will _____ leaflets about the charity event.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Change 'planning to distribute' to 'will give out', restructure sentence
distractors: give away (free distribution, similar but different)

transformations.sentence1: Despite experiencing technical difficulties, the lecturer didn't stop her presentation.
transformations.sentence2: The lecturer _____ her presentation despite technical difficulties.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform negative 'didn't stop' to positive phrasal verb, reorder concessive clause

transformations.sentence1: The committee made a decision not to accept the controversial proposal.
transformations.sentence2: The committee decided to _____ the controversial proposal.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform 'made decision not to accept' to 'decided to turn down' (double negative to positive)

transformations.sentence1: Owing to procedural complications, the parliamentary debate was delayed indefinitely.
transformations.sentence2: The parliamentary debate was _____ indefinitely owing to procedural complications.
transformations.cognitiveChallenge: Transform passive 'was delayed' to passive 'was put off', maintain structure

criticalThinkingSkills: Students must analyze the entire sentence structure, not just vocabulary
Multiple grammatical changes often required (tense, voice, word order)
Distractors force students to think about precise meanings of phrasal verbs
Context clues are essential - the 'obvious' answer may be wrong
Particle placement and separability must be considered
commonMistakes: Choosing a phrasal verb with the right verb but wrong particle
Forgetting to change tenses when transforming the sentence
Not recognizing when passive voice is needed
Missing that negative structures need different phrasal verbs
Ignoring that some transformations require adverb movement
assessmentGuidelines: Award full marks only for exact correct answer
Alternative answers must be equally valid in all contexts
Minor spelling errors may be overlooked if meaning is clear
Particle placement variations acceptable only where both are correct
Case insensitivity for answers (though keywords must be uppercase)
